loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo es socio del Banco Comunal Sumacc Huayta, tiene 46 años y es socio de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Guillermo se dedica a la joyería y platería. Las capacitaciones recibidas lo han ayudado en tener una buena educación financiera y ahora es, orgullosamente, uno de los mejores joyeros en Ayacucho. Con sus ahorros, Guillermo ha logrado comprarse un terreno. Con su préstamo actual, Guillermo invertirá en la compra de plata para la preparación de sus joyas.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 45, is a member of the Communal Bank "Sumacc Huayta" and has been a member of FINCA Peru for five years. He sells jewelry and articles of silver. The training he has received has given him a good financial education. He is now proud to say that he is one of the best jewelry merchants in Ayacucho. With his savings, Guillermo was able to buy a plot of land.

He will use this current loan to invest in the purchase of silver for making his jewelry pieces.

loans.use: to buy silver.

loans.name: Luís Azamat

texts.es:
El joven Luís Azamat es originario del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, es un profesional en la facultad de  Ingeniero Civil. Donde brinda sus servicios como tal en una Institución local desde hace varios años.

Es un joven soltero con muchos deseos de superación que pretende seguir preparándose para tener un mejor futuro y un mejor nivel de vida.

Es por tal razón que visitó por primera vez Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un crédito para pagar un curso universitario para tener un mejor nivel académico.
Confía en Dios y espera que esta Institución le brinde su apoyo para poder cumplir sus sueños, al cual le estará eternamente agradecido.
texts.en:
Luís Azamat is a native of the town of El Sauce, where he has lived his entire life.  He is a professional in the College of Civil Engineering and has been working as such in a local institution for several years.  He is a single young man with many desires for improving himself who plans to continue preparing himself to have a better future and a better standard of living.

This is why he visited CEPRODEL for the first time with the goal of requesting a loan to pay for a university course to have a higher academic level.

He trusts in God and hopes that this institution gives him its support to be able to realize his dreams, for which he will be eternally grateful to them.

loans.use: to pay for a university course.

loans.name: Nataly Yasmin

texts.es:
Nathaly es una joven de 22 años que tiene un pequeño que asiste al 4º grado de primaria, ella adora mucho pasar tiempo con su pequeño hijo. Actualmente trabaja c como moto taxista desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche con el fin de brindarle la mejor calidad de vida posible a su pequeña familia.

Actualmente ella atiende a un promedio de 40 clientes diarios, y siempre está pendiente de llevar a sus clientes por zonas y rutas seguras, ella está muy agradecida con su padre por haberle enseñado sobre este negocio debido a que así puede generar ingresos para su familia.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá realizarle un reforzamiento a la moto taxi que tiene, debido a que por la humedad esta se está deteriorando por la parte de abajo. Ella considera que este préstamo la ayudara a que su moto taxi dure más tiempo y así pueda continuar llevando alimentos y ropa para su hijo. Con mucho esfuerzo desea poder construir su casa de material noble donde se podrá sentir mucho más segura de cualquier contratiempo.
texts.en:
Nathaly is a 22-year-old young woman with a young child who attends fourth grade in elementary school.  She loves to spend time with her little son.  Currently she works as a motorcycle taxi driver from 8 in the morning until 8 at night with the goal of giving her small family the best quality of life.  She serves an average of 40 customers daily, and she always is ready to take her customers through safe areas and routes.  She is very grateful to her father for having taught her about this business because in this way she can generate income for her family.

With the help of the Kiva lenders she will be able to have maintenance done on her motorcycle taxi, which is deteriorating underneath because of the humidity.

She considers that this loan will help her so her motorcycle taxi lasts longer, and she will be able to continue bringing home food and clothing for her son.  With a lot of effort, she wants to be able to build her house of fine material so she will be able to feel much more secure about any setback.

loans.use: to have maintenance done on her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELES” iniciará su octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Daria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de muebles, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de verduras, venta de comida, venta de legía.

La señora Daría  indica que hace mucho tiempo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de madera) que comprará de las ferias de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Claveles" communal bank will begin its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board headed by Daria. The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses. Among them we have: furniture sales, knitting blankets, selling fruit, selling vegetables, selling food, and selling legía [an alkaloid used when chewing coca to draw out the active ingredient in the leaf].

Daria says the she has worked with Pro Mujer for a long time, joining at the invitation of a representative. Currently she has a business selling furniture, which she has been working at for years.

The loan that she will now receive is to increase her capital (purchase of wood), which she will buy at the markets of El Alto. After making the furniture, she will sell it at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training area.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: El Progreso Del Vallecito Group

texts.es: Virginia es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” grupo que está conformado por 07 personas responsables, la mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona. Virginia tiene 48 años de edad es conviviente y no tiene hijos. Hace más de 2 años que Virginia  se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza como  detergente, jabón, lejía, etc. Anteriormente trabajaba en una tiende vendiendo artículos de limpieza pues fue ahí donde se animo a emprender su propio negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su pareja ha podido cumplir una de sus metas comprarse su propio terreno y contar con un negocio propio. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El crédito que solicito lo utilizara como capital de trabajo comprando detergente, jabón, ambientadores, escobas, guantes, etc. Y así llegar a fidelizar a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso del Vallecito” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Virginia is a member of the "El Progreso del Vallecito" communal bank, which is comprised of 7 responsible people, the majority of whom are neighbors in this zone. Virginia is a 48-year-old with a live-in partner and no children. For over two years, she has been selling cleaning products like detergent, soap, bleach, etc. She used to work at a cleaning supply store, which is how she decided to start her own cleaning supply business. Thanks to her efforts and with the help of her partner, she has been able to reach some of her goals, which were to buy her own plot of land and start a business. Her next goal is to finish the construction of her house. The loan that she is requesting will be used as business capital to purchase detergent, soap, air fresheners, brooms, gloves, and other products, thus helping her to cultivate customer loyalty. The "El Progreso del Vallecito" communal bank is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, soap, air fresheners, brooms, and gloves.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталии 44 года, воспитывает одну дочку. 
С мая 2010 года, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Наталия решила заняться предоставлением услуг общественного питания, вложив  начальную сумму 80,000 сом (KGS). Приложив все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, Наталия добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 25,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от деятельности позволили Наталии арендовать более уютное здание под свое кафе.  
В целях дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса, Наталия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение оборотных средств для расширения ассортимента блюд в меню кафе, приобретения стульев и столов. Это позволит ей увеличить количество клиентов кафе, а также обеспечить рабочими местами местных студентов. Доходы от кредита Наталия планирует вложить развитие кафе, а в будущем мечтает создать сеть кафе в г.Жалал-Абад.
texts.en: Nataliya is 44 years old and raising a daughter.  In May of 2010, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Nataliya decided to get involved in providing food services and invested an initial sum of 80,000 som (KGS).  Putting all of her efforts into developing this business, she achieved success, and her monthly profit now amounts to about 25,000 som (KGS).  The earnings from this business allowed her to lease a more comfortable building for her cafe.  In order to continue developing her business, Nataliya requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase her working capital in order to expand the selection of the cafe menu offerings and to purchase chairs and tables.  This would allow her to increase the number of customers and provide employment for local students.  Nataliya plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her cafe and dreams of creating a chain of cafes in Jalal-Abad in the future.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es: La señora Elda es nueva integrante ella va a comprar con su prestamo pan, carne y verduras para elaborar hamburguesas, las otras integrantes siguen trabajando en la actividad que viene desarrollando. La Señora Minerva tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo quien es campesino, ellos tienen 4 hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones todos están estudiando 2 en la secundaria y 2 en la primaria, ella vende frutas y verduras, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar, chiles, tomates, jitomates, papas, cebollas, ajos, naranjas, sandia, plátanos, etc. para iniciar su negocio, ella va a emprender este negocio por necesidad como sus hijos estan estudiando y por donde vive no venden estos productos y la plaza esta retirada. ella esta feliz con el prestamo que va a recibir va a surtir su negocio y le va a ayudar con los ingresos de la familia. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que crezca su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan una profesion.
texts.en: Elda is a new member.  She is going to buy bread, meat, and vegetables with her loan in order to make hamburgers.  The other members continue working in the activity that is in progress.  Minerva is 34 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband who is a farmer.  They have 4 children, 2 girls and 2 boys.  They are all studying: 2 in high school and 2 in elementary school.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  She is asking for her loan to buy chile peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, garlic, oranges, water melons, bananas, etc. to start up her business.  She is going to launch this business  out of necessity since her children are students, and where she lives, these products are not sold, and the plaza is out-of-the-way.  She is happy with the loan that she is going to receive.  It is going to supply her business and it is going to help her with the family income.  Her dreams and hopes are that her business grows and that her children continue studying and have an occupation.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits like chile peppers, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, garlic, oranges, water melons, and bananas.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La Sra. Andrea tiene como principal  actividad económica, la venta de repuestos, lijas, hojas de sierre mecánica, en la feria mas populosa de la Ciudad de El Alto, vende los días jueves y domingos, a la vez se dedica a la confección de mandiles para cholitas y las vende al mismo tiempo, es una cliente antigua de buena actitud crediticia, el crédito lo invertirá en la  mano de obra para la construcción muro de contención de su domicilio, ella vive en la zona de Tacagua, la casa que es de su propiedad, también de el esposo quien es maestro rural y le ayuda al mismo tiempo con los gastos familiares. Tiene a su cargo un hijo de 16 años que esta en estudios secundarios, que a la vez le ayuda en cuanto a algunas de sus actividades, la Sra. Andrea es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Andrea's main business activity is selling spare parts, sandpaper and sheets for power saws.  She makes her sales in the busiest market in the city of El Alto on Thursdays and Sundays.  She also makes aprons for cholitas (women who wear traditional clothing).  She sells these products at the same time as she sells her other items. 

Andrea is an existing client who has a good payment record.  She will invest her loan in paying workers to build a retaining wall at her home.  She lives in Tacagua district, in her own home.  Her husband is a rural teacher and he helps her to cover their household expenses.  Andrea has one 16-year-old son in her care who is attending high school and also helps her in some of her activities.  Andrea is a very hard-working person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to pay workmen to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Handmaa

texts.en:
Handmaa is 60 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughter helps with her business. Handmaa started her garment retail business in 1993 by renting a counter in a market. 

Over the years, she has gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. She is known for her highly fashionable and relatively low-priced products. She is a bright and hardworking woman who says, "It's been a little hard since my husband passed away. However, for my daughter's sake, I will not give up." Now that her demand is increasing, she is requsting 3,300,000 MNT to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her clothing store.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province. Her husband works at a construction site, her elder three kids are school students and the youngest one is a kindergarden student.

Narantsetseg started her sewing business in 2004. She sews custom garments mostly traditional clothes. She is well known for her sewing skills around the neighborhood. Now that her product demand is increasing, she needs to buy more raw materials and more efficient sewing equipment. She is a talented diligent woman who is requesting 900,000 MNT in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en:
Dorjsuren is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his kids are school and kindergarden students. He started his transportation business in 2010 using his own pick-up truck. He transports goods to rural areas and he also collects firewood and coal and sells it. The firewood and coal business is going well. However, his truck broke down and needs some maintenance.

 He's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to meet the coal and firewood demand and to repair his car. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "Since my business is the main income in the family, it has been horrible with the broken pick-up truck."

loans.use: To purchase coal and to repair his pick-up truck.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходат женщина в возрасте 54 лет, мать пятерых детей.Её муж мастер по ремонту квартир.Шаходат работает в профессионально- техническом училище, техничкой. Её заработная плата не большая и абсолютно не хватает на расходы мероприятия. Недавно у Шаходат родился пятый внук, по этому поводу она хочет пригласить  гостей,а так же купить продукты,подарки для новорожденного, в связи с этим, решила получить кредит в сумме 2500 сомони.
texts.en: Shahodat is 54 year-old woman and mother of five children.  Her husband is a housing repairman.  Shahodat works as a janitor at a professional-technical college.  Her salary is not large and absolutely not enough for the event expenses.  Her fifth grandson was recently born, and she wants to invite guests and buy food and newborn presents for the occasion.  This is why she decided to request a loan in the sum of 2500 somoni.

loans.use: to purchase food and gifts for the newborn celebration

loans.name: Andres Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Andrés es un hombre de 58 años de edad,  el tiene una humilde vivienda donde está haciendo algunas remodelaciones para poder acabarla de construir, para lograr los ingresos suficientes para realizar estos arreglos, el se dedica a la venta de helados todos los días en una pequeña carretilla, desde hace 4 años.

El inicio este tipo de negocio debido a que tenía la idea de que debía tener un negocio propio donde podría mantenerse y salir adelante solo. Anteriormente ha trabajado en una chacra, este trabajo le permitió juntar su dinero y ahorrarlo para comprar lo necesario para su nuevo negocio.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva el podrá comprar algunas cosas para su hogar y así comprar una congeladora asegurada donde podrá mantener mucho mejor la calidad de sus helados. Él está muy contento por la ayuda que le podrán brindar, debido a que así podrá juntar lo que necesita para crear una bodega, o una pastelería o por fin tener una muy bonita heladería, entre risas dijo “ Aunque parezca gracioso si yo me lo propongo lo lograré”
texts.en:
Sr. Andrés is a 58-year-old gentleman who lives in a modest home where he has tackled a few remodeling projects needed to complete its construction. He has earned sufficient income necessary for making these repairs. Andrés has been selling ice cream every day from a small cart for the past four years.

He started this business because he came up with the idea of having his own enterprise where he could support himself and get ahead solely on his own. Andrés previously worked on a farm, which enabled him to earn money and save toward what he needed to start his new business.

With the help of Kiva lenders, Andrés will be able to buy a few things for his home as well as secure a freezer to better preserve the quality of his ice cream. He is very pleased with the assistance that has been provided. Andrés will also be able to gather what he needs to open either a store or a pastry shop, as well as have a nice ice cream shop in the end. He says with a laugh, “It may sound funny, but I plan to accomplish what I set out to do.”

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing ice cream.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene 27 años y es soltera con 2 hijos que son 3 años y 5 años todavía no se encuentran en la escuela, la Sra. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva de temporada, su puesto de venta se encuentra en la zona de Miraflores  este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución, la Sra. Lourdes va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos,  Lourdes enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de tener mas  clientes y  utilizara los beneficios  en la educación de sus hijos,  sueña para su negocio a futuro  expandir su negocio a poblaciones del sur de santa cruz.
texts.en: Ms. Lourdes is a 27-year-old single woman with 2 children, ages 3 and 5, who do not yet attend school. Ms. Lourdes sells the season's latest fashions for a living. She runs a stand in the Miraflores neighborhood. She is currently in her first loan cycle with the institute. Ms. Lourdes will use this loan to purchase the season's fashions wholesale, thus increasing her business capital and improving her income. Lourdes is facing some challenges in her business, such increasing her clientele, so she will use the profits on her children's education. She dreams of expanding her business to towns south of Santa Cruz.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale seasonal apparel.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 43 años de edad, casado y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, cuentan con casa propia la misma que esta ubicada en el caserío que lleva por nombre “Sequion”, es un caserío pequeño donde loas habitantes normalmente se dedican al comercio de ganado y a la agricultura. El caserío pertenece al distrito de Olmos a dos horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ángel desde mucho tiempo atrás se ha dedicado a la ganadería, pues a la actualidad se viene dedicando a la crianza, engorde, y comercialización de ganado, el recorre todos los caserío aledaños al suyo buscando ovinos, caprinos, vacunos para comprarlo engordarlos y ofrecerlos en el mercado de Chiclayo, cuenta con el apoyo de esposa eh hijos para la criaza de los mismos pues como familia se han apoyado siempre en sus negocios para lo que trabajan unidos.
Ahora esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con los que comprará animales menores como: aves de corral y ganado vacuno con lo que podar aumentar su capital de trabajo y así pueda satisfacer a todos sus clientes.

Es un cliente recurrente demostrando muy buen comportamiento de pago con sus cuotas asignadas. Créditos que utilizó en invertir en su negocio y en las mejoras de su domicilio
texts.en:
Ángel is 43, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He has his own house, located in the settlement called "Sequion", a small village where the inhabitants make their living selling cattle and farming. The village is part of Olmos district, approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Ángel has raised livestock for a long time, and currently he raises, fattens, and sells livestock. He travels to all the neighboring villages looking for sheep, goats, and cattle to buy and then fatten and sell in Chiclayo market. He has the help of his wife and children for raising them, since as a family, they have always supported one another in their businesses, so they work together. 

Now he is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, that he will use to buy smaller animals such as poultry and cattle. This enables him to increase his working capital and satisfy all his customers. He is a repeat client who demonstrates a very good payment record with respect to his scheduled installments.

He used these loans to invest in his business and in improvements to his home.

loans.use: To buy cattle and poultry.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 33 años de edad y es parte del grupo Girasol dice que le pusieron así al grupo por que donde se reúne el grupo había muchas flores de "Girasol" y por eso le pusieron ese nombre.
Platica doña Mary, como de cariño le dicen sus conocidos, que tiene un puesto de frutas y legumbres de temporada, dice que vende sus frutas en diferentes tianguis de la región y en el Estado de México donde ya tiene un puesto estable y donde su esposo le ayuda a cuidar el puesto, ella surte su fruta en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella. Ella quiere pedir un crédito a la financiera para la compra de guayaba, durazno, lechuga, chiles verdes, jitomates, aguacates, mango, mandarina, naranja etc. Dice que el crédito le urge ya que no tiene surtido su negocio y ella quisiera tener  mucha fruta para poder así tener buenas ganancias. Dice que también una parte del crédito lo destinara para la compra de abonos orgánicos e insecticidas ya que tiene 60 árboles de aguacate y quisiera seguir manteniéndolos en buen estado ya que por las fuertes heladas que han caído en su comunidad le afectaron quemando sus árboles y los quiere nutrir para que no se pierdan por completo. Platica que una de sus metas es seguir surtiendo su puesto de frutas y legumbres y hacer crecer su huerto ya que es la herencia que le puede dejar a sus menores hijos. Los otros tres integrantes del grupo se llaman José, Jorge Luis y Agustina ellos ocuparan su crédito para la compra de frutas y legumbres.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and a member of the 'Girasol' (Sunflower) group.  She says that they gave the group this name because where their group meets there are a lot of sunflowers.

Mary, as her friends call her, has a stall where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She says that she sells her fruit in different markets in the region and also in the State of Mexico where she has a stable sales location and where her husband helps her out.  She stocks up with fruit in the wholesale food market in a nearby town.  She would like to request a loan from our institution to buy guava, peaches, lettuce, green chilis, tomatoes, avocados, mandarins, oranges, etc.  She says that she needs this loan as she doesn't have enough stock for her business and she would like to have a lot of fruit so that she can make good profits.  She says that she will also use part of her loan to buy organic fertilizers and insecticides as she has 60 avocado trees and she would like to keep them in good health because the harsh frosts that have hit her community affected her, burning her trees.  She would like to feed them so that she doesn't lose them completely.  Mary says that one of her goals is to continue stocking her fruit and veg stall and grow her orchard as it is an inheritance that she can leave her children.

The other members of this group are called José, Jorge Luis and Agustina.  They will use their loan to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy guava, peaches, lettuce, green chilis, tomatoes, avocados, mangos, mandarins, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Nyamdorj is 50 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tuv province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed, and his daughter is a student. 

Nyamdorj started his taxi business in 2010 using his own car. Even though he's fairly new to this field, he has already found regular customers. However, his car is very old, and the engine is broken down. He's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to replace his car's engine. The fact that his business provides the only income has been hard on the family. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have to do everything I can to support my family."

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his car.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Oyungerel is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, and her two kids are college students. 

Oyungerel started her wool handcrafting business in 2008. Since then, she has developed a community with five members, and her products are becoming extremely popular. She mostly makes scarves and gloves, and her products are elegant and high quality. She's requesting 600,000 MNT to buy string and wool to meet the demand for her product. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my business is picking up, I will work even harder."

loans.use: to buy string and wool for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en: Mendbayar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife looks after his children; their elder kid attends school and the younger one is a kindergarden student. He started his carpentering business in 2007. He makes a wide range of products including tables, chairs, beds, etc. His work is highly qualified and elegant. He is well equipped. Now that Mongolian holiday season is approaching, his product demand is increasing. Therefore, he's requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy raw materials.

loans.use: To get more wood and other necessary materials

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан 54 года, проживает с семьей сына и заботится о двух внуках.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  15 лет назад Бактыкан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду, Бактыкан смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 3 дойной коровы и 20 овец, что приносит около 8,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Бактыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Baktykan is 54 years old and lives with her son's family.  She takes care of her two grandchildren. Fifteen years ago, she started her own business in animal husbandry as a main source of income for her family.  Through hard work, she was able to expand her farming business which now consists of 3 dairy cows and 20 sheep, bringing about 8,000 som from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In order to further develop her business, Baktykan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to purchase young bulls.  She plans to invest the earnings into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Monica Agustina

texts.es: Mónica es una mujer de 41 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su tienda su historia empezó por la falta de oportunidades emplee por este negocio y me está yendo bien a veces bueno y malos días pero estoy tranquila, su trabajo lo hace con su hijo abre desde la mañana hasta la noche, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es crecer con mi negocio y desde mejor vida a mi hijo y familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su tienda.
texts.en:
Mónica is 41 years old and has great hopes for the future of her store. She started the store because there weren’t many other employment opportunities. On the whole it is going well, although there are good days and bad days. She is generally content. 

Mónica is helped by her son. They open the store in the morning and work until night. There are some problems with crime. She isn’t married but does have children. Her greatest wish is to grow the business and provide a better life for her son and family. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy stock for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Maritza Alejandra

texts.es: Maritza es una mujer de 35 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó hace 5 años se separo de su conviviente con el que empezó su negocio de venta de pescado y mariscos en el mercado municipal de la parroquia, su trabajo lo hace sola lunes a domingo de 4 am hasta las 3 pm, no tiene dificultades, es madre soltera, tiene1 hija, su sueño más importante es mejorar su negocio. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de pescado y mariscos.
texts.en: Maritza is 35 years old. She has many aspirations in the next few years to make her business prosper. Her story began 5 years ago when she separated from her partner, with whom she started her business selling fish and shellfish in the municipal market of her parish. She does her work alone every day from 4am until 3pm, and she has no difficulties. She is a single mother and has one daughter. Her biggest dream is to improve her business. For this she wants the loan for her fish and shellfish sales.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shellfish

loans.name: El Moralito Group

texts.es: Doña Beatriz tiene la edad de 37 años y tiene un grupo llamado El Moralito, platica  que todos los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle ese nombre porque la colonia donde viven se llama el Moral y para identificarlo más fácilmente decidieron ponerle el moralito. Platica que ella está muy contenta por tener un grupo muy trabajador y que no queda mal con los pagos ya que entre todos se ayudan. Ella es una mujer que día a día trabaja para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, dice que desde muy pequeña empezó ayudándole a su papá con un puesto de frituras y hotcakes donde ella aprendió muy bien el trabajo. Dice que ahorita tiene más de 15 años con su propio negocio, ella vende en ferias y fiestas patronales donde vende churros, chicharrones preparados, papas a la francesa, hotcakes, refrescos, papas doradas con salsa y muchas cosas más, dice que quiere un crédito para la compra de papas, cajeta, mermelada de fresa, de guayaba, leche condensada e ingredientes para hacer los hotcakes y para la compra de aceite, diferentes tipos de salsas y fresas empaquetadas para la venta de fresas con crema. Dice que ella compra todos los productos que ocupa en diferentes tiendas de su comunidad donde le den precios más bajos, platica que una de sus metas es ampliar su negocio y comprar una camioneta de uso para poder transportarse más rápidamente con sus artículos que vende en las ferias. Las otras nueve integrantes del grupo se llaman Gloria, Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, María Felicitas, Olivia, Ana Laura, Ana Lilia, Pablo, Javier ellos invertirán bisutería y accesorios para el pelo, cosméticos y perfumería para dama y caballero, ropa para dama y caballero, insumos para hacer hotcakes y mantenimiento a un taxi.
texts.en:
Doña Beatriz, age 37, leads a group called El Moralito. Their neighbourhood is called El Moral, and to identify themselves easily, all the mmbers decided to call the group El Moralito. Beatriz is very happy to have such a hardworking group: there have been no problems with repayments, and they all help each other. She is a woman who works hard to improve her living conditions. From a very young age she began helping at her father's stall selling chips and pancakes, where she learned well. She now has over 15 years experience in her own business, selling churros, chips, French fries, pancakes, drinks, roast potatoes and gravy and much more, at fairs and festivals. She wants a loan to buy potatoes, caramel, strawberry jam, guava jam, condensed milk, ingredients to make pancakes, cooking oil, different types of sauces, and packs of strawberries to sell strawberries and cream. She buys all the products in local stores, where they give her the best prices. One of her goals is to expand her business and buy a used truck to transport her goods more quickly. 

The other nine members of the group are called Gloria, Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela Maria Felicitas, Olivia, Ana Laura, Ana Lilia, Pablo, and Javier. They plan to invest in: jewelry and hair accessories, cosmetics and perfumes for men and women, women's clothing, men's clothing, supplies for making pancakes, and repairs to a taxi.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, syrup, strawberry jam, guava jam, condensed milk, ingredients to make pancakes, cooking oil, different types of sauces, and packs of strawberries to sell strawberries and cream.

loans.name: Las Miciones Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento MICIONES esta compuesta por 9 integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones, fue elegida como presidenta la Sra. Rosmery tiene 33 años no es casada pero tiene su pareja con la que convive, tienen 2 hijos que son 9 y13 años. Rosmery se dedica a la  Venta de cosméticos, joyas que vende de manera ambulante los la zona donde vive y por otras distintas zonas este préstamo es su tercera secuencia con la institución y Rosmery utilizar el crédito para la compra de cosméticos por docena y así de esta manera incrementar su capital, La Sra. Rosmery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela, utilizara los beneficios del crédito en  mejorar  la calidad de vida a su familia, sueña tener su puesto propio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos a su clientes sin necesidad e estar ambulando, se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: The enterprising communal bank MICIONES [Missions] is made up of 9 members: seven women and two men.  Rosmery was chosen as the president.  She is 33 years old.  She is not married, but she has a partner that she lives with.  They have 2 children that are 9 and 13 years old.  Rosmery is a traveling salesperson of cosmetics and jewelry in the area where she lives and in other different areas.  This loan is the third sequence with the institution, and Rosmery will use the loan to buy cosmetics by the dozen, and therefore in this way increase her capital.  Rosmery faces challenges in her business like increasing customers.  She will use the benefits of the loan to improve the quality of her family's life.  She hopes to have her own place where she can offer her products to her customers without needing to travel.  She feels very grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her.

loans.use: buy wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children, aged four to 13 years. She describes herself as a quiet woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, salt, blueband, and stationery. She has been involved in this business for ten years, and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are butchers. In addition, she farms livestock and sells goats. 

Wayua describes insufficient funds to improve her business as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 15,000 KES loan to purchase goats for her livestock farming business. Her business goal is to own a slaughter house near town within five years.

loans.use: to buy goats for her livestock business.

loans.name: Miriam Maritza

texts.es: Miriam es una mujer de 38 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de mariscos su historia empezó en las afueras del mercado y después se me concedió  y pude adquirir un puesto, su trabajo lo hace compro en la caraguay 6:00 hasta las 13:00, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener una cevichería grande y aportar mis ingresos a mi familia. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de mariscos.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 38-year-old woman who has many aspirations of prospering her seafood business within the next few years. Her story began outside of the marketplace, but afterwards she was approached and given the opportunity to acquire a vending post. Miriam's work involves buying her products in La Caraguay at 6am and selling until 1pm. She faces difficulties, such as crime. Miriam is not married, but has children.

Her greatest wish is to open a large "cevicheria" (a restaurant that serves marinated seafood) so that she can provide more income for her family. For this reason, this loan will be used for her seafood sales business.

loans.use: to buy fish and other seafood.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 47 años que no tiene hijos y vive con su esposa en "Los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha (donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador), "posee 52 centros poblados entre comunidades, recintos y cooperativas distribuidas en toda la geografía cantonal. El territorio cantonal se encuentra un importante recurso natural como es el Bosque Protector Mindo Nambillo. Una gran superficie del área cantonal se encuentra ocupada de pastizales ya que la principal actividad del cantón es la ganadería este cultivo, también se realizan cultivos de palmito, caña de azúcar, plátano, naranjilla en pequeñas superficies."


Pablo tiene un taller de arte, él talla figuras de manera artesanal desde hace 15 años, aprendió este oficio con varios jóvenes hace mucho tiempo y hoy es su forma de vida. Trabaja hasta 12 horas en el día cuando tiene muchos pedidos y su esposa le ayuda en algunas actividades. El obstáculo que tiene es en encontrar un ayudante que sepa de este arte ya que en este ámbito esto es un poco difícil. Pero el está dispuesto a ampliar su negocio por lo que quiere invertir en materiales y seguir en búsqueda de alguien con quien aumente su producción.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a visitar a sus familiares. Pablo cree que hay poco apoyo a artesanos como él, y espera seguir con su negocio que es lo que más le gusta hacer.
texts.en:
47-year old Pablo doesn’t have any children and lives with his wife in Los Bancos, one of the nine cantons in the province of Pichincha (where the capital of Ecuador is also located). There are 52 different communities in the canton. The surrounding area holds an important natural resource, the "Mindo Nambillo" Protective Forest. A large area of the canton is covered by grasslands, and the principal economic activity there is cattle-raising. People in the canton also farm palm heart, sugarcane, bananas, and naranjillas over smaller areas. 

Pablo has a workshop where he has made crafts for fifteen years. He and several other young people learned to carve a long time ago, and today it is how he earns his living. He works up to twelve hours a day when there are orders to fill. His wife also helps him. 

The problem at the moment is finding an assistant who knows how to do this work as it is quite difficult to do. However, Pablo is keen to expand his business so he wants to buy materials and continue the search for someone to help him increase production.

In his free time Pablo likes to visit family members. He believes that there is very little support for artisans like himself. He hopes to continue with the business as it is what he most enjoys doing.

loans.use: to buy materials and hire an assistant

loans.name: Martha Maribel

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 34 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su venta de calzado su historia empezó desde pequeño aprendió el oficio de comerciante artesanía en zapatos, su trabajo lo hace sola muestra sus productos desde temprano, tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, está casada, si tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener su casa. Por eso quiere el préstamo para su venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Martha is 34 years old and has great hopes that her shoe-selling business will do well over the next few years. She learned the trade when she was young.

Martha works alone. She starts showing her wares to customers early in the morning. She has a few problems with crime. She is married and has children. Her greatest wish is to have a house of her own. For this reason she would like a loan for her shoe business.

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
Marisela tiene 24 años de edad, no tiene hijos y actualmente vive en la casa de su abuelita a quien apoya económicamente, la casa en la que vive esta ubicada en un caserío pequeño de nombre “Laynas” el mismo que pertenece a al distrito de La Matanza en la provincia de Morropón – Piura

Marisela es una joven que tiene muchos deseos de superación, por lo que ya ha iniciado su negocio de venta de chicha de jora (bebida oriunda de los incas), ella desde muy tempranas horas inicia la preparación de sus insumos con los que obtendrá la chicha para ser comercializada a sus vecinos y personas que trabajan en campo, ya su negocio lo viene manejando hace dos años aproximadamente.

Ella quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, y para poder atender a sus clientes necesita de accesorios como cocina, ollas, sillas y mesas en las que pueda brindar una mejor atención, y por eso que esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1008 Nuevos Soles los cuales invertirá en los antes mencionado, y es su abuelita la que la apoya en sus actividades diarias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisela is a 24-year-old woman with no children. She lives in the house of her grandmother, whom she is supporting. Their house is located in a small hamlet called "Laynas," which is a part of the La Matanza district in the Morropón – Piura province. Marisela is a young woman who has a strong desire to get ahead, which is why she has started her own chicha de jora (a traditional Incan drink made of fermented maize) business. She begins preparing the ingredients very early in the morning, making the chicha to sell to her neighbors and to the local field workers. She has been in business for approximately two years.

She would like to expand her business and be able to better serve her customers with things like a stove, pots, chairs, and tables, which is why she is requesting a 1,008.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will be invested in the aforementioned supplies. Her grandmother helps her with her daily business activities.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, and a stove for her business.

loans.name: Orgilbulag

texts.en: Orgilbulag is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (a Mongolian  yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband works at a construction site. Since 2009, Orgilbulag has operated a grocery business at a local market. In 2010, she also started a sewing business. She sews custom garments, mostly traditional clothes. She is well known by her sewing skills around the neighborhood. Now that her product demand is increasing, she needs to buy more materials and more efficient sewing equipment. She is a talented young woman, and she is requesting 500,000 MNT to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment for her sewing business.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 45 years old and lives with her daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her daughter helps with her business. 

Oyunchimeg started her grocery shop business in 2007. Her workplace was built by her late husband, and her shop location is good. When her husband passed away, her business basically stopped for about three months. Therefore, she's requesting 2,000,000 MNT to resume her business and buy products to stock her store. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "For the sake of my daughter, I have to stop feeling sorry about my husband."

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mendsaihan

texts.en:
Mendsaihan is 46 years old and lives with her two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her elder child is a college student, and the younger one is in school. 

Mendsaihan started her shoe-making business in 2002. She makes traditional shoes that are elegant and high quality. Over the years, she has gained many regular customers and trusted suppliers. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my boy has started college, I have to work even harder in order to support him." She is requesting 350,000 MNT to buy leather and other materials.

loans.use: to buy leather and other materials.

loans.name: Fatyma

texts.ru: Фатыме 57 лет, замужем.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  25 лет назад Фатыма начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Стартовав с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду, Фатыма смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в сумме  15,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Фатыма обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы Фатыма планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Fatyma is 57 years old and married.  Twenty-five years ago, she started her own business in animal husbandry, as a main source of income for her family.  With an initial amount of 50,000 som (KGS), and through hard work, she was able to expand her farming business, and earn 15,000 som per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to purchase young bulls.  Fatyma plans to invest the earnings into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Alejandrina Bernardina

texts.es:
Este es el segundo préstamo se la señora Alejandrina, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza en su domicilio, todo el día se dedica a la venta de estos productos para poder ayudar a su familia, su esposo también es un hombre muy responsable, actualmente el trabaja como obrero de construcción y esto les ha permitido salir adelante en el transcurso de estos años.

Actualmente ella tiene una consultoría, donde atiende a un promedio de 20 personas al día, es gracias a su experiencia que inicio este tipo de negocio y esta iniciativa propia la está llevando a lograr muchas cosas que deseaba, entre ellas sacar a su 4 hijos adelante.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, ella podrá realizar la compra de una vitrina y también desea acondicionar un nuevo espacio en su nueva consultoría. Con esta ayuda ella podrá incrementar sus ingresos y ese dinero extra le permitirá pagar los estudios de sus hijos, los mismos que están por terminar sus estudios superiores, uno de 22 y el de 17.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Alejandrina’s second loan. She sells beauty products from her home every day in order to help her family. In addition, her husband is a responsible gentleman who currently is employed as a construction worker. This has enabled them to move forward over the course of the past few years.

Alejandrina has a consultation business where she meets an average of 20 people a day. Thanks to her experience, she was able to start this business. Through her own initiative, Alejandrina was able to achieve many of the things that she set out to do, such as helping her four children get ahead.

With the assistance of the Kiva lenders, she will be able to buy a display case and also remodel a new space for her consultation business. As a result of this help, she will increase her income and the extra money will enable her to pay for her children’s education. Her children, ages 22 and 17, are in the process of finishing their higher education.

loans.use: to buy a display case and pay for remodeling expenses.

loans.name: Carlos William

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 33 años de edad, no tiene hijos y actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de su madre, la que esta ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “CP-15 Cruceta” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura. Es un caserío pequeño donde actualmente solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Su actividad económica principal de Carlos es dedicarse a la agricultura, para lo que en la actualidad ha sembrado sus plantaciones de limón, producto el cual cosecha semanalmente y sale a comercializarlos en los mercados de su distrito, adicionalmente también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino los que cría en la parte posterior de su casa, recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza, están dispuestos seguir creciendo y a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carlos esta solicitando un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para la compra de fertilizantes para su sembrios y alimentos balanceados para sus animales y poder ofrecerlos a mejores precios, sabe que hay demanda suficiente por satisfacer y a la vez obtener mayores utilidades con las que podrá cumplir sus objetivos..

Debido a su buen carácter y su responsabilidad en su negocio ha hecho que sus vecinos le guarden respeto y consideración.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old.  He has no children and currently is living in his mother's house, located in the rural village named CP-15 Cruceta, in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is a small village where currently the only service they have is electricity.

Carlos's principal economic activity is working in agriculture.  Currently he has planted his lands with lime, a product he harvests weekly and goes out to sell in the markets in his area.  He also works raising and selling sheep, which he raises behind his house.  He receives help from his wife in the work he does.  They are ready to continue growing and improve their quality of life.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the sum of 1000 PEN to buy fertilizer for his crops and balanced feed for his animals, to be able to offer them at better prices.  He knows there is enough demand to satisfy and at the same time get better profits, with which he will be able to realize his goals.

Because of his good character and his responsibility in his business, he has made his neighbors have respect and consideration for him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and balanced feed.

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 44 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, her elder two children are college students, and her younger two are in school. She started her water distribution business in 1990. Her well provides water for nearly 200 households. Its location is convenient and well-known around the neighborhood. However, her well equipment is getting old, and it needs to be replaced. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are in college, I just can't stop my business now." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her water distribution business.

loans.name: Esmeralda Eugenia

texts.es:
Esmeralda, vive junto a sus padres, hermanos y primos, la vivienda es familiar, ella está soltera, no dependen de sus ingresos, se dedica a atender un negocio de piñatería, en el cual ofrece el producto principal que son las piñatas, dulces, sorpresas infantiles, adornos, y todo lo necesario para fiestas de cumpleaños y actividades sociales, este negocio lo tiene junto con un primo desde hace dos años, tienen a parte dos empleados que les ayudan a atender la clientela. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de piñatas como papel, engrudo, colorante, tambien comprara dulces, adornos, para surtir el negocio, esto le permitirá mejorar el inventario y tener lo suficiente para atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es a través del financiamiento mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, que sus ventas aumenten y así desarrollarse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Esmeralda lives in the family home with her parents, siblings, and cousins. She is single and has no financial dependents. Esmeralda manages a piñata business where she offers her main product of piñatas, but also candy, children's surprise gifts, decorations, and everything needed for birthday parties and social events. She and her cousin have operated this business for the past two years. They have two employees who help attend to the customers.

Esmeralda is currently requesting a loan for making piñatas such as paper, paste, and dye. She will also buy candy and decorations to restock her business. This will enable her to improve her investment and have everything she needs to serve her customers. Her aspiration for this loan is to improve the inventory of her business so that her sales will increase. In addition, she will be able to develop in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy paper, paste, dyes, candy, and decorations.

loans.name: Para Siempre Group

texts.es:
Ricarda cuenta con 38 años de edad, es casada tiene 1 hija se llama Alberta esta enferma síndrome de down, su esposo se llama silvino es campesino, ella se dedica al comercio de dulces ya tiene 5 años con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de dulce nuevos, sabritas, jugos etc. A doña Ricarda le gustaría que el negocio creciera, espera que le vaya muy bien, está contenta porque el negocio es una fuente de ingresos para su familia pero tiene todas las ganas para salir adelante junto su esposo y su hija.

Ricarda pertenece al grupo "Para Siempre" el cual esta integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Emma, Jorgina, Ricarda, Quintina, Ma del Rocio, Eridia, Celsa, Danelia, Norma, Itzel, todas realizan actividades comerciales como son: venta de pan, dulces, calzado, cosméticos, comida, huaraches, etc.
texts.en:
Ricarda is a 38-year-old married mother of one daughter, Alberta, who has Down's Syndrome. Her husband, Silvino, is a field worker. She has been selling candy for 5 years, and will invest her loan in purchasing new candy, chips, juice, etc. Ms. Ricarda would like for her business to grow. She hopes that it will prosper, and she is happy because the business is a source of income for her family. She really wants to get ahead with her husband and daughter.

Ricarda is a member of the "Para Siempre" group, which consists of the following 10 enterprising women: Emma, Jorgina, Ricarda, Quintina, Ma del Rocio, Eridia, Celsa, Danelia, Norma, and Itzel. They all own businesses and sell things like bread, candy, footwear, cosmetics, food, sandals, etc.

loans.use: to purchase candy, chips, juice, and other goods.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Cortijo Group

texts.es:
Juana cuenta con 59 años de edad es viuda, tiene un hijo con ella el cual esta estudiando la preparatoria 3° grado, ella es comerciante tiene la venta de pollos lo cual dice que le va muy bien espera que todo le salga bien e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de pollos para vender y sacar al negocio adelante ya que es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Juana pertenece al grupo vista hermosa cortijo el cual esta integrado por 12 personas las cuales todas son mujeres a las que le gusta trabajar a continuación serán mencionadas: Maria Guadalupe, Florencia, Osmayda Nayeli, Juana, Gloria, Maria Elena, Teresa, Justina, Refugia, Francisca, Tomasa, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de perfumes, productos de abarrotes, refrescos, pollos, dulces, pescados, comida, etc.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old and a widow. She has a son with her who is studying at the 3rd level of secondary school. She is a merchant who sells chickens and she says it is going very well. She hopes it will continue to go well and will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens to sell and move her business forward. Her business is the source of her family’s income.

Juana belongs to the Vista Hermosa Cortijo group, which is made of 12 people, all of whom are women who enjoy working. They are Maria Guadalupe, Florencia, Osmayda Nayeli, Juana, Gloria, Maria Elena, Teresa, Justina, Refugia, Francisca, Tomasa. All engage in commercial activities, such as the sale of perfume, groceries, soft drinks, chickens, sweets, fish, food, etc.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Esteffany Jhoany

texts.es:
Esteffany es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en el departamento de Ica, El departamento de Ica es el único de la costa sur formado por planicies, también llamadas llanuras costeñas, puesto que la Cordillera de los Andes se levanta muy al interior. En Ica se encuentran extensos desiertos, como las Pampas de Lancha, las Pampas de Villacurí, en donde el calor es muy intenso, ofrece playas y aguas termales, variada fauna marina, museos de sitio y excelentes servicios de hoteles; a Esteffany le gusta mucho escuchar música cuando dispone de algún tiempo libre, asi como también le gusta mucho la comida peruana y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa” y también el “Ceviche”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Esteffany logro iniciar su negocio de venta de zapatos, ella es muy dinámica y sobre todo muy alegre, en el día puede atender hasta 3 clientes en el día,  ella realiza la venta de sus productos visitando a los clientes en sus domicilios, ella  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática, brinda facilidades de pago por la compra de sus productos y tiene modelos muy bonitos de zapatos.

Esteffany agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio (zapatos temporada de verano y escolar), lo que le permitirá tener mejor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, asi seguirá trabajando cada dia para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su tienda de venta de calzados”.
texts.en:
Esteffany is a very hard-working and keen young woman who is 22 years old and lives in Ica department.  Ica department is the only department on the south coast which is formed by plains (also called coastal plains because the Andean mountain range rises inland).  There are extensive deserts in Ica such as the 'Pampas de Lancha' and the 'Pampas de Villacurí' where the heat is very intense.  There are beaches and thermal springs, a variety of marine life, museums and excellent hotels.  Esteffany really enjoys listening to music whenever she has free time.  She also enjoys Peruvian food and one of her favorite dishes is the delicious 'arroz chaufa' (Chinese Peruvian fried rice) and 'ceviche' (marinated fish dish).

With a lot of effort and commitment, Esteffany managed to set up her business selling shoes.  She is very dynamic and, above all, very cheerful.  She can serve up to three customers a day.  Esteffany makes her sales by visiting her customers in their homes.  She believes that her business is doing well because she is very charming and provides good repayment terms for people buying her products.  She also sells very nice shoes.

Esteffany is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (summer shoes and school shoes).  This will enable her to have a better variety of products to sell and to improve her income.  She will be able to continue working every day in order to fulfill her biggest dream: to own a shoe store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer shoes and school shoes)

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
As the picture shows, 73-year-old Amos runs a tea farming business. He comes across as an amiable, good-humored, and high-spirited gentleman. At his age, many would reckon the father of eight should be thinking of retirement, but Amos is not having any of it. He says he will remain unwavering and unfazed in his purposefulness.

Tea farming is a business he has a penchant for, and he says it's been worthwhile in every sense of the word. He also ekes out a supplementary income from banana farming.  

Amos plans on using his loan to purchase high grade manure for his tea farms and banana plantation. He is upbeat, and he envisions better sales returns after the acquisition of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his tea farms and banana plantation.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 31 years old. He lives in a small village of the Kareli district in the eastern part of the country. Vladimer is married and lives with his family: his wife Nina, his two daughters (six and one years old), and his 82-year-old grandmother. 

The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. The family owns 2.5 hectares of land, where they grow cabbage, tomatoes, garlic, strawberries, apples, and peach-trees. Vladimer sells the harvested products at the local market. Vladimer and Nina also take care of a milk cow. They produce Georgian cheese and sell it at the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 640 Laris, including the monthly pension of Vladimer’s grandmother. 

Vladimer requested a loan to cover the expenses of land cultivation and purchase onion seeds. In the spring, Vladimer will have a new product for sale. This will increase the income of the family, and they will be able to spend more on family needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor for land cultivation and to purchase onion seed.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 37 years old, and he lives in the Achajur village in the Tavush area with his wife, his five-year-old son, and his mother. Suren’s mother is a retiree, and his wife is a housewife. 

Suren is a laborer, and he and his family are also engaged in land cultivation and animal husbandry. On their farm, they have two cows, two pigs, a donkey, and some chickens. They also grow wheat, fruits, and vegetables. They use the majority of their produce for family consumption, and they sell the rest to their fellow villagers. 

Thanks to income from farming, Suren provides for his family. He intends to develop his farm, so he is asking for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy four calves. This will allow Suren to increase his family’s income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy four calves for his farm.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and two children. He really wishes to offer a suitable life to his family, especially his children, and for this reason he’s working nonstop to be able improve their way of living. He has been working in tailoring and installing curtains since 2008 and has his own factory. Today, he wants to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional textiles and materials for his business. He notes that this will develop his work thus his productivity. In the future, he plans to open his own curtain shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles and materials for his business

loans.name: Jack

texts.en: Jack is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings one of whom is working. His father is responsible for his family but Jack does not hesitate to show help whenever needed.  He has been working in manufacturing refrigerators since 2005. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of stainless tubes for his business, in order to increase his productivity and therefore his revenues. In the future, he plans to better develop his work and gain added clients.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of stainless tubes for his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one child. He’s the main income provider for the family and their only support. For this reason, he decided to have his own business, hoping to add some special changes in their life. 

After many years of experience as a barber, Ali opened his own barber shop in 2006. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan, from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., to change his salon’s interior decoration and to purchase new barbering tools. In this way, he will be able to gain added clients and to improve his business. In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to change his salon’s interior decoration and to purchase new barbering tools.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings who are all studying. Kassem’s father is the main income provider in the family and their only support. For this reason, Kassem decided to start his own business, hoping to help his father with their expenses. After two years of experience as a barber, he opened his own barber shop in 2009. He is now requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new barbering tools. In that way, he will be able to gain added clients and improve his business.  In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase new barbering tools

loans.name: Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Felix cuenta con 45 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 19 años de edad, termino la preparatoria el año pasado y dice que por ahora no tiene oportunidad de seguir estudiando pero si la hay la a aprovechara, ella es comerciante tiene la venta de refrescos, jugos, sabritas, y verduras lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de  refrescos, sabritas, jugos y verduras como son: jitomate, chile, cebolla, etc. Ya tiene 3 años con su negocio y dice que poco a poco va incrementando, A doña Felix le gustaría que su negocio fuera mas grande ella dice que lo esta sacando adelante y espera convertirlo en una tienda mas grande esta muy contenta porque el préstamo le esta ayudando bastante.

Félix pertenece al grupo santa cruz el cual esta integrado por 11 personas las cuales todas son mujeres trabajadoras a continuación  serán mencionadas: Leonarda, Guadalupe, Reyna, Hortensia, Lucila, Carolina, Suleyma, Graciela, Alili, Hermas. Todas realizan actividades comerciales como son: venta de pan, refrescos, verduras, dulces, puercos, comida, Fríjol, perfumes, abarrotes, mangos, pescados, etc.
texts.en:
Felix is a 45-year-old single mother of a 19-year-old daughter who finished high school last year, and though she does not have the opportunity to continue her education, she states that she will take advantage of one if she ever gets it. Felix is a businesswoman who sells soda, juice, chips, and vegetables. She will invest her loan in purchasing these products, and vegetables like tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, etc. She has been in business for 3 years, and she says that it is expanding little by little. Ms. Felix would like for her business to grow, and she is helping it progress. She hopes to convert it to a bigger store, and she is happy because the loan is a great help.

Felix is a member of the Santa Cruz group, which consists of the following 11 enterprising women: Leonarda, Guadalupe, Reyna, Hortensia, Lucila, Carolina, Suleyma, Graciela, Alili, Hermas. They all own businesses and sell things like bread, soft drinks, vegetables, candy, pigs, food, beans, perfume, groceries, mangoes, fish, etc.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juice, and vegetables like tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She works with her husband tilling their land and planting rice. Leonila has been a rice farmer for ten years. She is able to use the income she earns to help provide for her family. Leonila works hard to balance her time between farming and her family.

Leonila is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes that her loan will help increase her family’s harvest and income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm inputs

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 51 years old and is married with ten children. Her husband works as a carpenter. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells items such as soy sauce, vinegar, biscuits, and canned goods. She earns about 5,000 PHP from her business and works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Ludivina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and soft drinks. She hopes for her business to progress and improve.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice and softdrinks

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey used his previous loan to buy a heifer to rear. His major business challenges are price fluctuations and seasonal weather. 

Godfrey is requesting a loan to buy another heifer. His dream is to educate his children, buy a car, and own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Mirvate

texts.en:
Mirvate is a 23-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She is working along with her husband to fulfill their family's needs. Mirvate has been working from her home as a tailor for the past three years . She also works as a wedding organizer and decorator.

Today, she is requesting a youth loan, from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to purchase additional tailoring supplies such as textiles and some wedding planning supplies for her other business. This kiva loan will boost her productivity and also her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own wedding planning company.

loans.use: to purchase textiles for tailoring and wedding planning supplies.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 24-year-old Lebanese married man who’s living with his wife and one child. He’s the one responsible for his family and looking to enhance their way of living. He has owned a pickup since 1999. He transports fruits and vegetables to the neighborhood shops. He works independently on a free-lance basis. 

Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to repair his pickup and perform the needed maintenance on it. This will certainly facilitate his business operations and develop his job. In the future, he plans to buy a bigger pickup and serve a wider range of customers.

loans.use: to repair his pickup and perform the needed maintenance on it.

loans.name: Pascale

texts.en:
Pascale is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and one working sibling. They’re all cooperating together to be able to cover their expenses. As for Pascale, she has been working as a private teacher since 2008 from her home. She’s intelligent, an expert in her field and sometimes visits her students at home. In parallel, she has been teaching in a local school.  

Today, she’s in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase book shelves where she can place her documents in a proper way and have some privacy. In that way, she will be able to develop her method of communication with her students. In the future, she plans to focus on one job and have her own family and children.

loans.use: to purchase book shelves where she can place her documents in a proper way and have some privacy.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 28-year-old, Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents. Jack’s father is trying his best to provide an appropriate life for his family. 

Jack has owned a mobile shop since 2010. He has more than a few ideas to develop his business. 

Today, Jack is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional mobile phones for his shop. This loan will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his sales. In the future, Jack plans to open a bigger shop to include additional supplies.

loans.use: to buy additional mobile phones for his shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old Lebanese man who is engaged. He lives with his parent and two siblings, one of whom is working. Ali and his brother are responsible for covering their family's costs and expenses. 

Ali started his own business at an earlier age. He has owned an internet café since 2009. 

Today, Ali is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate his shop and purchase a new computer. This Kiva loan will boost his work and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and add more computers to it.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is  20 years old and single. He lives with his parents and two working siblings.  In 2010, he opened a clothing shop where he sells stylish, fashionable, and trendy clothes.

Hussein is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase a new collection of clothes such as pants, scarves, t-shirts, and many other items. He notes that this loan will certainly push him to get higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches of his store.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes such as pants, scarves, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and single. He lives with his one parent and sibling in addition to four other relatives. He has been working in wall foliage for the past six years. 

Mohammad is requesting a youth loan from Ameen s.a.l., which he will use to purchase added construction supplies for his business.  In the future, he plans to open his own wall foliage products shop.

loans.use: to purchase added construction supplies for his business.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 20-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and seven siblings, one of whom is working.  He had many years of experience in the construction field; then he decided to work on his own and take on his own projects. He’s expert in his field and has gained a fair number of clients. Today, he needs to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed construction tools. This loan will facilitate his business operations and augment his revenues. In the future, he plans to attract more clients and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase needed construction tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child. Unlike others his age, he works really hard just to give his family a respectable life. This pushes him to take on responsibilities and start to work early on his own. 

 Ali opened his own motorcycle repair shop in 2009 and still has it. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed mechanical supplies for his business. He expects a fair increase in his profits, therefore his productivity. In the future, he plans to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase needed mechanical supplies for his business

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 36 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2001 года Миргул занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Миргул смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 2,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Миргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
texts.en: Mirgul is 36 years old, she is married with four children. As a main source of income for her family Mirgul has been doing animal husbandry since 2001. Starting with the amount of 2,000 som (KGS) Mirgul was able to develop her business with a monthly profit of 2,000 som. In order to further develop her business Mirgul has come to Bai Tushim and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Mirgul plans to invest the revenue from the loan in a further increase of headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.ru: Кымбат  39 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей.  В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи,  с 2000 года Кымбат занимается животноводством. Стартовав с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), Кымбат смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью в 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кымбат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Кымбат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья.
