She has insufficient funds now, so she is borrowing a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for hog sustenance. She is hoping for good health and no illnesses to alight on her hogs. She hopes to merchandise them at a higher cost. 

Someday, she hopes to save funds to use in case of emergency for she is getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and medicines for hog sustenance

loans.name: Roxana Jeaneth

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 33 años de edad es madre de dos niñas de 6 y 8 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida que se dedica a elaborar pan dulce como donas, entre otros. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que tiene dos años de dedicarse a la crianza de animales domésticos como pollos y cerdos. Estas labores las aprendió por cuenta propia, ya que tomo la decisión de iniciar el cuido de estos animales para luego engordarlos y vender la carne en las tiendas del municipio donde vive, siendo esta su fuente de ingresos y le sirve para aprovechar su tiempo.

Roxana viaja cada 6 semanas a comprar los pollos para engorde, el viaje dura una en autobús hasta llegar a la ciudad. Ella esta identificando que el negocio de la crianza de pollos de engorde es rentable, por eso solicita a Fundación Campo un préstamo para comprar 50 pollos y el resto del dinero será para la elaboración de pan dulce (donas).

Con la inversión ella espera comprar más pollos de los que ha tenido, para tener una fuente de ingresos mayor, mejorando su condición de vida, al vender sus pollos y así ir creciendo y extendiéndose en el mercado con la venta de carne obteniendo mayores ingresos para su hogar. Más adelante ella piensa construir su propia galera más grande y ser un cliente potencial en la venta de pollos en su zona y también brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is 33 years old and the mother of two girls who are 6 and 8 years old. She lives with her life partner who works making pastries such as donas, among others. She is a hardworking woman who has been raising domestic animals, such as chickens and pigs, for two years. She learned these tasks of her own account since she made the decision to begin caring for these animals in order to fatten them up and sell the meat in the shops of the municipality where she lives. This is her source of income and it allows her to take best advantage of her time.

Roxana travels every 6 weeks to buy chickens to fatten up. The trip takes an hour by bus to arrive at the city. She has identified the business of raising chickens for meat as profitable, and this is why she requests a loan from Fundación Campo to buy 50 chickens, and the rest of the money will be for making pastries (donas).

With the investment she hopes to buy more chickens than she has ever had, to have a greater source of income and improve her living conditions. Upon selling the chickens and in this way growing and extending herself in the market by selling the meat she is obtaining greater income for her home. Going forward she is thinking of expanding her chicken coop and being a powerful client in chicken sales in her region, and also providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens, and the rest of the money will be for making pastries (donas).

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is from the village of Cabisera 15. She is 54 years old and is married with three adult children.

Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks, and spices for her store.

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som, 63, is married, the mother of seven children and lives in a village in the Thmor Koul district. She has only two children who are still dependent on her. One of her children is a farmer while the another one is working in Malaysia. She owns a three-hectare farm where she has grown crops for the last 15 years to earn money to help her family survive. Som has been with VisionFund since 2007 and completely repaid her last loan. She used this loan to make her family's living better, with sufficient food to eat, decent shelter etc. Now, she is applying for another loan with her loan group member, who has just joined with VisionFund. Som will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so that she can set aside money to do some building on the ground floor of her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Soriya's Group

texts.en: Soriya is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children who are still in school. To support her family, she has been running a small grocery stall for the last four years. The stall is located in her village in the Thmor Koul district, and she sells soap, detergent, seasonings, etc. Soriya's loan group consists of two woman who have been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Since 2008, her loans have helped her support her family and improve her business. She now earns more than $20 a day but can save less than $5 a day. Now her group is requesting another loan with VisionFund for KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy more grocery items to sell in her store and buy a pump to use on her land and in her house. With this loan, she hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en: Lorina is 46 years old and earns a living by raising pigs. She has been in this business for four years and has succeeded at improving her family's economic status. With the combined effort of her husband, they are slowly improving their lives. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy food and medicine for her pigs. She hopes to use this loan to develop her business and someday totally move out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is married and 41 years of age. She is a housewife and performs her household duties. 

Her husband operates two businesses. In the morning he drives an auto-rickshaw, while in the evening he sells buffalo milk to his community clients.In his absence, Surriya takes care of the cattle and helps him by managing his business.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband, who wants to repair his auto-rickshaw. By doing that he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and improve his business.

He is an experienced person in his business and Surriya is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his transport business by investing the loan money.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Surriya.

loans.use: to repair her husband's auto-rickshaw for his transport business.

loans.name: José Nicolas

texts.es:
José tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedica a la agricultura.  Los insumos agrícolas, los compra en una ciudad del oriente del país y también en un cantón.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo es para comprar madera para reparar el techo de su vivienda.  Con la reparación del techo él junto a su familia podrán trasladarse a vivir ahí, por que actualmente esta viviendo con sus suegros. Su casa estará segura y podrán tener privacidad en su propia casa, con el tiempo y la ayuda de la Fundación piensa mejorar las condiciones de su casa como el techo, paredes y el piso, entre otro más.  Así tendrá mejores condiciones que ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old and lives with his life companion and two children. He has worked as a farmer since he was very young. He buys his farming supplies in a city in the east of the country and also in a canton.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy wood to repair the roof of his dwelling. With the roof repaired, he and his family will be able to move in and live there because currently he is living with his in-laws. His house will be safe and he will be able to have privacy in his own home. Over time and with the help of the Fundación he intends to improve the condition of his house such as the roof, walls and floor, among other things. Thus he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga vive en la aldea de San José de Orocuina junto con ella vive sus 2 hijos. Sus hijos son su gran apoyo ya que son ellos quienes le ayudan en su actividad. Ella es muy trabajadora muy entregada a su negocio de venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde 30 años en su comunidad donde vive. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, azúcar, arroz, refrescos y embutidos, para vender en su negocio.
Es una persona muy responsable  y  honrada cada día que pasa trabaja muy fuerte para sacar sus hijos adelante y crecer en su actividad.
texts.en:
Dominga lives in the village of San José de Orocuina with her 2 children. Her children greatly support her by helping her carrying on her activity.  She is very hardworking and truly dedicated to her general store, an activity she has been running for 30 years in her community. The loan she is requesting will be uses to buy beans, meat, sugar, rice, soft drinks and canned food to sell in her shop.
She is a very responsible and honest person, and she works very hard day by day to provide for her children and to make her activity grow.

loans.use: To buy beans, meat, sugar, rice, soft drinks and canned food.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is 59 years old and lives in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom (one son and one daughter) are working. She is a farmer with a two-hectare lot. This is her main source of income but she also sometimes works for pay as extra income. She has been with these businesses for five years as a way to support her family. Pov joined VisionFund six loan cycles ago and has successfully paid back her loans to VisionFund. Since 2006, these loans have helped her keep farming and made is possible to buy household comforts for her family. Now, she earns around $8 per day and saves around $2.50 each day. Pov and her loan group member Chea are requesting another loan of KHR 1,400,000 each. As a leader, she will use this loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will allow her to earn a larger income so she can buy a new motorbike and keep helping her family live better.

loans.use: to buy seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanrasy's Group

texts.en: Chanrasy is 42 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district of Cambodia and earns a living by farming as her main source of income and by running a grocery store to earn additional income. She has been with these businesses for five years. Chanrasy leads a three-person loan group and is now in her fourth loan cycle as a client with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Since 2009, these loans have helped her afford sufficient food for her family and send her children to school. Now she is requesting another loan with her group members for KHR 1,400,000 each. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and additional grocery items to sell, such as detergent, food, etc. She hopes to earn more income so that she can enlarge her farm and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Belkis Candelaria

texts.es: Belkys  con su nuevo credikiva comprará materias primas e inusmos para elaborar sus deliciosas comidas, porque se acerca la temporada de carnaval, donde se aumentan sus ventas especialmente en su restaurante. Ella está aplicando a esta inversión, teniendo en cuenta la experiencia de su anterior credikiva, con el que le fue bien porque aumentó ligeramente su capital de trabajo especialmente en las épocas de mayor movimiento comercial, en las que invirtió. En consecuencia su éxito radica en su experiencia en el mercado y además en la escogencia precisa de la temporada  en la que invierte, por eso su dinero se multiplica  mediante su trabajo.
texts.en: Belkys will use her new Kiva loan to buy raw materials and ingredients for making her delicious foods, because carnival season is approaching, which is when her sales increase, especially in her restaurant. She is applying for this loan, taking into account her experience with her previous Kiva loan. With it she was able to increase her working capital somewhat, especially in the seasons of greater commercial activity, which is when she invested. As a result, her success is based in her experience in the market and also in her ability to choose exactly when to invest so that her money can multiply through her work.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make her delicious food

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
59 years old, Em is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of them are dependent. She has been running a food stall for two years, selling papaya snacks and boiled duck eggs to make a living. Her two dependent daughters also help her with this current business. However, she can save only 1.50 USD from her current business. 

Em and her other group member have just joined VisionFund this cycle. She is applying for a loan with VisionFund to buy various types of biscuits for sale, in addition to her existing business. She hopes that this business will grow well and enable her to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy biscuits for resale

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son. He makes ladies' wallets and handbags. With the loan investment, he will buy leather, thread, and other raw material used in making handbags and wallets of better quality and in larger quantity. This will allow him to fulfill larger orders and increase his sales and profits. Surriya is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She does this to share the financial burden with her family.

Her remaining two sons also have businesses making ladies' wallets, while her daughter is a beautician. Surriya is confident that by investing the loan, her son will successfully be able to increase his sales and profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and other raw material to make ladies' handbags and wallets

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en: Prudencio is 24 years old. He is married and has two children. He has been involved in farming for 15 years. He has 1.5 hectares of land, where he grows rice. He sells his harvest to traders. He earned about 35,000 PHP from his last crop. The income from his business helps him to provide for the needs of his family and give his children a higher education. Thus, Prudencio wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further grow his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: Katerine a sus 24 años ya tiene una microempresa de preparación de alimentos, que le genera ingresos para sostener sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 9 años. En su negocio vende pollo, carne asada, perros calientes, arepas, papas rellenas y otras delicias, que hacen que su clientela se sostenga fiel. Desde hace 3 años desde que decidió dar rienda suelta a su emprendedora idea, no ha dejado de invertirle, para desarrollarla y lograr crecimiento; en su negocio ella cuenta  con un asador de pollos, hornos, congeladores y su carro de perros. La meta de Katerine es hacer crecer su negocio aun más y esto lo está logrando con un buen servicio, además de ofrecer un producto agradable al paladar, higiénico y fresco totalmente. Sus clientes la refieren y ya su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para atender la creciente demanda; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará insumos para la preparación de productos y bebidas para responde a la demanda insatisfecha del sector, aprovechando que se acercan los carnavales y las ventas usualmente se incrementan en esta época, por ello Katherine debe tener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: At 24 years old, Katerine already has a small store preparing food which helps her generate income to support her three children aged 2 to 9 years old. In her business she sells chicken, carne asada, hot dogs, arepas (doughy pancake filled with meat or cheese), stuffed potatoes and other delicacies that keeps her client base loyal. Three years ago she decided to let her entrepenurial spirit loose; she hasn't stopped investing in it to keep it growing and make sure it is successful. She has a chicken roaster in her business, as well as ovens, freezers, and a hot dog cart. Katerine's goal is to grow her business even more and she is achieving this with good service as well as offering a hygenic, fresh palate-pleaser. Her clients referred her since her working capital is insufficient to accomodate the growing demand. This is why she is applying for a loan, her first with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase products for the preparation of food as well as drinks to be able to respond to the unsatisfied demand of the area. She is taking advantage of the fact that Carnavales are approaching and sales usually increase in this season; it is for this reason that Katerine needs her business to be well-stocked.

loans.use: to purchase products  to make food and beverages for her store

loans.name: Monica Chaverra

texts.es:
Mónica ha trabajado en su negocio de la venta de helados desde que tuvo su segundo hijo y se dio cuenta junto con su esposo que el salario que ganaba este no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Mónica tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 8 años, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena calidad de vida. Mónica atiende su negocio de helados tanto a ventas de 1 sola unidad como para atender grandes cantidades como para atender eventos, entre otros. Mónica tiene el anhelo de conseguir abrir un local donde pueda ofrecer sus productos al público de forma más abierta y atenderlos con productos no solo que vengan empacados sino ella también preparar copas de helado, bananas, entre otros. Dado que un cliente suyo le ha hecho un pedido de una gran cantidad de helados, Mónica requiere comprar estos productos a su proveedor, sin embargo, Mónica no cuenta con el capital suficiente para esto, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de helados en gran cantidad para atender un pedido de un cliente y a pagar los primeros meses de arriendo del local donde va a montar su venta al público.

Mónica espera que de esta manera su negocio aumente las ventas, pues ya estará más visible para las personas pues no atenderá el negocio desde su casa y así generará los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mónica has worked in her business of selling ice cream since she had her second child and realized together with her husband that the salary that he earned would not cover the necessary expenses for sustaining the household. Mónica has two children ages 3 and 8 years old, who she has always wanted to offer a good quality of life. Mónica  attends to her business of ice cream as much to sales of only 1 unit as for attending to great quantities, as for attending to events, among others. Mónica has the desire to achieve opening a shop where she can offer her products to the public in a more open way and serve them with not only packaged products but also to prepare glasses of ice cream, bananas, etc. Given that a customer has made a large quanitity order of ice cream, Mónica needs to purchase these products from her vendor. However, Mónica doesn't have the sufficient capital for this, which is why she aspires to obtain a loan that provides her the opportunity to agree to the purchase of ice cream in a large quantity to fulfill a client order and pay the first months of rent of a shop where she can set up her sale to the public.

Mónica hopes that in this way her business grows in sales, and she will be more visible for the people that will not come to her business from her house and in this way she will generate the necessary income to sustain her household.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream in great quantities in order to fulfill an order from a customer and to pay the first months rent of a shop where she is going to set up her sale to the public.

loans.name: Quintin

texts.en:
Quintin is 45 years old, married,  and has five children. He is engaged in the rice farming business, which he has been doing for 25 years. Through the income gained from farming, Quintin was able to send his children to school. One of his children finished college and holds a degree.

Quintin is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his rice crop. With the loan, he hopes to be successful in his business. He will manage his farm to gain income. 

Quintin's goal in life is to see his children become professionals someday. He works hard to further support his children's needs in pursuing their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his rice crop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a student, taking college level courses. While studying, he helps his mother manage their large rice crop. 

Michael is requesting a loan for 40,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. This loan will be a big help for Michael to meet their farming needs. Michael's dream is to finish his education and have a stable job. He is very excited to get work someday and will help his mother in financial matters.

loans.use: to purchase ertilizers and rice seeds to grow.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is requesting a loan for her clothes selling business, which she will use to buy clothes in bulk quantities for wholesale rates. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of clothes to her clients and increase her sales and profits.

Perveen is relatively new in her business and hopes that by utilizing the loan, she will be able to establish herself in this business. Her husband works in wheat market selling wheat. He purchases wheat from different farmers and supplies different flour making factories for profit.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Ovidio

texts.es:
Jorge se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la actividad de la agricultura, gracias a que su familia se ha dedicado a esta actividad por varias generaciones. Gracias a que Jorge es una persona que cuida muy bien de su dinero, fue ahorrando poco a poco y fue expandiendo la tierra donde cultiva. Actualmente ya tiene 8000 plantas de la fresa, una fruta que en el mercado se vende a un muy buen precio. Sin embargo, estas plantas no le están alcanzando para cubrir todos los requerimientos de sus clientes, pues le hacen pedidos por mayor cantidad que la que está en capacidad de producir. Gracias a esta circunstancia, Jorge puede afirmar que requiere emplear a personas que requieran de unos ingresos y no hayan encontrado oportunidades laborales en otras partes, pues debe aumentar sus cultivos hasta unas 12.000 plantas. Con el ánimo de llevar esta actividad a cabo, Jorge requiere comprar semillas y abono para sembrar las nuevas plantas, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de las mismas; es por esto que acude a un préstamo con la esperanza en que este le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de semillas de fresa y abono para cultivar más plantas de esta fruta.

Jorge espera que su negocio siga creciendo y que su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Espera que sus 3 hijos puedan acceder a una educación superior y toda su familia encuentre una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jorge has worked in agriculture almost his entire life, since his family has worked in this area for a number of generations. Thanks to the fact that Jorge is a person who is very careful with his money, he saved little by little and expanded the land that he cultivates. Now he already has 8000 strawberry plants, whose fruit sells for a very good price in the marketplace. Nevertheless, these plants are not sufficient to meet all the requests of his customers, since they give him orders for a larger quantity than he is able to produce. Thanks to this situation, Jorge can state that he needs to employ people who need some income and have not found working opportunities in other places, since he needs to enlarge his plantings to some 12,000 plants. With the spirit to carry out this plan, Jorge needs to buy seeds and compost to plant the new plants. Nevertheless, he does not have sufficient capital to buy them. For this reason, he has turned to a loan with the hope that this will offer him the opportunity to make the purchase of strawberry seeds and compost to cultivate more plants that bear this fruit.

Jorge hopes that his business will continue to grow and that his family can enjoy a better quality of life. He hopes that his three children can have access to higher education and that all his family will have economic stability.

loans.use: to buy strawberry seeds and compost to grow more plants bearing this fruit

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernando se dedica a la ganadería desde muy temprana edad, pues su padre se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó a su hijo desde que era muy joven. Hernando poco a poco ha ido incrementando la cantidad de ganado que tiene en su tierra y gracias a esto ha podido generar más ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Gracias a la buena calidad y el buen servicio que ofrece Hernando, sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos y por esto con el pasar del tiempo ha ido captando más clientes para su negocio. Debido a que ahora tiene más pedidos de sus clientes de los que puede satisfacer, busca poder incrementar la cantidad de ganado que cría en su tierra y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una buena venta. Sin embargo, como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de los nuevos ganados para la cría, Hernando aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de ganado que le permita incrementar su capacidad productiva para poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Hernando espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten y le permita ofrecerle a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. Además, Hernando sueña con poder tener una gran parcela donde pueda emplear a otras personas que estén en situaciones muy vulnerables y nunca hayan encontrado oportunidades laborales.
texts.en:
Hernando has been raising cattle since he was very young. His father also did this and taught his son from an early age. Little by little, Hernando has been increasing the quantity of cattle he has on his land and thanks to his effort, he has been able to generate more income to sustain his family. The good quality and service he offers has resulted in customer satisfaction and with the passage of time, he has won over additional customers for his business.

Since Hernando now has more customer orders than he can satisfy, he is looking for ways to increase the quantity of cattle he raises on his land, and to offer his customers good sales. However, since he lacks sufficient capital to buy new cattle to raise, Hernando is seeking a loan that would offer the possibility of buying the cattle necessary to increase his productive capacity, allowing him to fill his customers' orders.

Hernando hopes in this way to increase his income and offer his wife a better quality of life. In addition, Hernando dreams of obtaining a larger parcel of land where he could employ other people who are in very vulnerable situations and have never found work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy cattle, increasing productive capacity, and to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Banco Mujer El Alba Group

texts.es:
Jeisel de 21 años de edad, madre soltera y tiene un niño de 5 años, vive sola con su hijo, tiene casa propia, y es comerciante desde hace algún tiempo. Una mujer muy trabajadora y comprometida con su grupo, Banco Mujer El Alba, donde desempeña el puesto de tesorera.
Ella ha tenido 2 préstamo con Fundación Mujer, pero es el primer con Banco Mujer El Alba, y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como ropa, sandalias y perfumes. Es muy buena vendedora, y  los ingresos que le genera su negocio es lo que le ha permitido salir adelante. Pese a los obstáculos que ha tenido que enfrentar, como falta de dinero para invertir entre otras situaciones, ella se ha propuesto mejorar la calidad de vida, darle los estudios a su hijo, y continuar estudiando, sueña con poder asistir a la Universidad, y está luchando para lograrlo. 
Junto a Jeisel están 6 integrantes más, que desarrollan actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Jeisel is 21 years old; she is a single mother with a five-year-old son.  She lives alone with her son in her own home and she has been a storekeeper for some time now.  She is a very hardworking woman who is committed to her group, Banco Mujer El Alba, where she acts as treasurer.

She has taken out two loans with Fundación Mujer, but this is her first loan with Banco Mujer El Alba and she will use the loan to buy merchandise, such as clothing, sandals, and perfumes.  She is a very good salesperson and the income she makes at her business is what has allowed her to get ahead.  In spite of the obstacles she has faced, such as lack of investment money, among other situations, she has made it her goal to improve her quality of life, to send her son to school, and to keep studying.  Her dream is to be able to attend a university and she is working hard to achieve it.

There are six other members besides Jeisel, who work in agriculture and livestock and commerce.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of merchandise.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Connie es una mujer muy joven de 22 años, madre una niña de solamente un año de edad, vive con su compañero en una pequeña casita que han construido con mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos, el préstamo se va a invertir en la compra de pollos y concentrado. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita el grupo y Connie es la presidente del Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras. 
El mayor deseo de Connie es incrementar su ventas y así aumentar sus ganancias para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, ya que su compañero tiene un ingreso económico muy bajo. 
El grupo Las Luchadoras está compuesto por 8 socias incluyendo a Doña Connie, que van a invertir  en actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Connie is a very young, 22-year-old woman.  She is the mother of a little girl who is only one year old.  She lives with her partner in a small house they built with a lot of effort.  She raises and sells chickens for a living and she will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.  This is the second loan her group is taking out and Connie is the president of Banco Mujer Las Luchadoras.

Connie's greatest wish is to increase her sales and thereby increase her earnings to be able to help with her family's expenses, since her partner has a very low income.

The Las Luchadoras group is made up of eight members including Connie who will invest in farming, livestock, and small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Arnolfo

texts.en:
Arnolfo is 47 year old. He is married and has four children. He is in the hog fattening business and he is supporting his family. He considers himself a hardworking and responsible person.

He dreams that his children will graduate from college and get good jobs. So he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional feeds, vitamins and additional livestock. He wishes that this investment would increase the family income in order to save for the schooling of his children and to grant his dream.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds, vitamins and additional livestock.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias lives with his wife and six children. He supports his family through his piggery business and his farming business. With 10 years of operating these businesses, he proudly says that it provides for his family’s needs. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to exceed his usual profit from these businesses. It would be used to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs. Hopefully, it will make his pigs healthier in order to dispose of them at a higher price. Through these actions, the family will overcome the poorer living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 57 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for the last 10 years. He usually buys piglets, fattens them and then sells them for a profit five months later. He is also a farmer who contributes greatly in helping to improve the lifestyle of his village.


To gain more income, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. He will use this loan to purchase feed and vitamins for his hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his hog fattening business.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married and operates a sewing business. She is very skillful and acquired her skills from her mother. Due to her good sewing skills, she receives regular orders every month.

Rukhsana is requesting a loan from Asasah for her brother’s transportation business. He drives an autorickshaw and gives pick up and drop off services to his passengers to their destination. With the loan, he will buy a new autorickshaw as he currently drives a rented rickshaw. By purchasing a new autorickshaw, he will be able to increase his income because he will no longer need to pay rent.

Rukhsana is hopeful that her brother’s business will improve with the loan and she will be able to save some profits for his marriage in near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new autorickshaw for transport business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 59 years old, married and has three children. Pablo is engage in planting and harvesting of rice in their village. Pablo is a wise man. He plants rice earlier to assure that his crop will sell to a higher price. He also plants rice earlier to avoid many diseases that may hit his crop.

Pablo is asking for a loan of PHP40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He wants to be the earliest to plant rice. He believes that, through the loan, he can do it. Pablo looks towards the success of his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
Agrifina is 57 years old and has three children. She is widowed and carries the burden alone in providing for the needs of the family. She is still sending her children to college for their education. Her cooking skills really help her in generating income. She cooks and sells daily food for meals and snacks. 

Agrifina needs to meet her customers' demands for the delicious meals that she offers. She is asking for additional capital towards buying ingredients for food preparation such as onions, eggs, vegetables, pork and chicken meat. She is asking for PHP35,000. She promises to pay her loan on time. 

With a positive outlook on life, she hopes to make her family live more fortunately.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation. These items, such as onions, eggs, vegetables, pork and chicken meat will be used to cook and sell.

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado peacefully resides at Nangalisan with her spouse and three children. Two of the children attend school. The primary source of income in the village where they live depends on rice and corn farming. Amado was involved in raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. He usually sells his crop to traders in their village and earns approximately PHP15,000 each harvest season(April and November). He has had insufficient funds to sustain his crops, so he is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming. 

Amado hopes to make his crops more productive so he can earn more profit. Amado prays for strong and good health in order to keep developing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
At the age of 48, Lanie still generates an income for the education of her only child. She had to provide a good education as the only legacy she could give. She was separated from her spouse due to some personal reasons, which is why she carries the burden alone in providing for their needs. 

She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more sacks of used clothing, shoes and caps to sell. She would like to increase her sales so that she could save funds for unexpected expenses. 

Someday, she hopes to acquire a good income from her business to alleviate their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of used clothing, shoes and caps to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Selling "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) is Myra's business. She is patiently selling these items in order to generate an income to meet her family's daily needs. She was engaged in an early marriage. At the age of 31, she has already been gifted with three children. Two are in elementary education. 

She would like to improve her business, so she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more used clothes to sell, including caps and belts. Her spouse is Myra's partner in the business. With a good income, she hopes to provide a better education for her children. 

Myra is also praying to receive all the fruits of their hard work.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell including caps and belts.

loans.name: Allen Joy

texts.en:
Allen Joy is 27 years old and a married woman. She is peacefully living with her husband and two infant children. Her husband is a government employee within their community while she is in charge in taking care of her children. 

Allen Joy has been running her livestock business for five years. For the long period of time she has devoted, she is able to help her husband in sustaining their basic needs. Since her previous hogs were disposed of already due to their maturity, Allen decided to buy more hogs to raise. 

Currently she is raising three hogs for fattening and two as sows. With the number of hogs she is raising, she will need more capital in order to sustain their daily feed supply. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy feed for her livestock business. 

Through feeding her hogs three times a day, she can gain better profits because she can offer them at a greater price. She believes she can attain her goal for her family, which is to provide them with a better way of living and save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María  vive en la zona de Vara Blanca,provincia de Heredia, sus habitantes se dedican principalmente a la ganaderia de leche y el turismo. Hace tres años esta zona  se vio afectada por el terremoto de Cinchona, el cual tuvo serias consecuencias para los habitantes del lugar; al igual que algunos vecinos, doña Ana tuvo que irse a otro lugar. Luego con ayuda de una institucion del estado obtuvieron ayuda para reparar sus casas y volver a las mismas.
 Atualmente doña Ana produce pan que vende los fines de semana a los turistas que visitan la zona, esto lo hace afuera de su casa, además quiere empezar a producir pizzas que distribuira servicio express en los hoteles de la zona. Para esto necesita crédito pues solo posee el horno y requiere comprar algun equipo para  mejorar su producción. Para mas adelante Ana María tiene el proyecto de remodelar totalmente su casa y convertirla en una casa imitación piedra a la que llama la PICAPIEDRA, complementando así el servicio que brinda actualmente.
texts.en:
Ana María lives in the Vara Blanca zone in the Heredia province.  Its inhabitants primarily devote themselves to dairy cows and tourism.  

Three years ago this zone was affected by the Chinchona earthquake.  This had serious consequences for the inhabitants of the area.  Just like some of her neighbors, Ana had to move to another place.  Then, with the help of a state institution, they got help to repair their houses and return to them.

Ana now makes bread to sell on the week-ends.  She sells outside of her house to the tourists who are visiting the zone.  She also wants to start making pizzas that would be delivered by express service to the hotels in the zone.  To do so she needs a loan.  She only has an oven, and she needs to buy some equipment to improve her production.

Later on Ana María has a project to totally remodel her house.  She will convert it into a house with imitation stone, which is called “picapiedra”.  This will complement the service that she now provides.

loans.use: to buy part of the equipment she will use to make breads and pizzas.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel's goal in life is to harvest good crops every season. Her goal will lead her to gain more income and give a better way of life for her family. Richel and her husband have run a rice farming business in their village for 11 years. 

Richel has three children who are in school. She and her husband are helping each other to improve their living standards and bring their family out of poverty. They are a hard-working couple. 

Richel is in need of additional assistance to maintain the business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and seeds for farming. Richel hopes that she can manage her business well until her children attain a college level of education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is happy to live with his wife and four children. Most of the residents in their village are farmers. Joaquin is one those farmers whose primary source of income is from growing rice. Joaquin is 33 years of age and has been engaged in farming for almost 14 years. 

Joaquin patiently manages his business because he has no other source of income for he and his family to live on. He has no chance for other employment because he did not finish his education. Joaquin has the perseverance to work for the future of his children. He wants them to go to college when the time comes. 

Due to insufficient funds from farming, Joaquin is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and seeds. He hopes that someday he will give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 38 years old, married and has three children. She raises pigs at home for resale at the markets. She has had three years experience with this type of business. She is taking out a loan to purchase two more hogs to raise, vitamins and feeds. Her loan amount, PHP20,000, would be a great help in maintaining her business as well as in improving the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase two more hogs to raise, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
"Dedication and wise management of business" are the guiding principles that push Estrelita to strive for a better way of living. Estrelita is married to a farmer, having four grown up children. Among her four children, two have settled into marriage already; one is working and the other one is still studying.

Estrelita works hard in order to earn her living. She owns and runs her variety store within her local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost seventeen years. She is grateful because her previous loan has really helped her in maintaining her business and making it grow continuously. At this time, she is asking for bigger capital, amounting to PHP50,000, which will be used to buy groceries such as canned goods, cooking oil, detergent soap, beverages, candy, ingredients and biscuits to re-stock her store. In this way, she can encourage more customers to buy her merchandise and to satisfy her customers' demands to her. She is hoping that this amount will eventually help her in obtaining her goal.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, cooking oil, detergent soap, beverages, candy, ingredients and biscuits for the store.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 48-year-old married man, residing in Sta. Luciana, Cauayan city. 

To earn a living, Reynaldo operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for 25 years. Every cropping season, he earns 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and rice seedlings. In the future, Reynaldo wants to improve his family's living conditions and lift them out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Bernando Antonio

texts.es:
Bernardo es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a esta cualidad ha podido salir adelante con su familia. Bernardo se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Desde hace aproximadamente 8 meses, por adversidades que le presentó la vida con su antiguo empleo, Bernardo montó su propio negocio el cual le permite generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Bernardo en su tienda general ha ido incorporando poco a poco con el paso del tiempo más productos de la canasta familiar, y de esta manera ha ido montando su negocio con mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes. Gracias al buen servicio que ofrece Bernardo su clientela ha ido aumentando con el paso del tiempo, lo que le ha permitido aumentar sus ventas y seguir progresando junto con su familia. Gracias a que sus ventas son muy buenas, Bernardo ha tenido que ir aumentando su inventario de productos, es por esto que dado el poco capital que tiene, busca un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar el inventario de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Bernardo sueña con seguir aumentando sus ingresos para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Espera poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos el ingreso a una educación universitaria donde se preparen y obtengan un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a very hard-working person and, as a result, he has been able to make progress with his family.  Bernardo is married and has two children to whom he has always wanted to offer a good education.  Eight months ago, owing to difficulties in his job, Bernardo set up his own business which allows him to make income with which to support his family.  Over time, he has gradually added more basic household products to his general store and increased the variety of products that he offers his customers.  Thanks to Bernardo's good customer service, he has managed to increase his business and his sales.  This has allowed him to make progress with his family.  Thanks to the fact that he has good sales, Bernardo has had to increase his stock of goods.  As he doesn't have much capital, he is looking to take out a loan which will enable him to buy basic household products and thereby increase his stock.

Bernardo dreams of continuing to increase his income so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.  He hopes to be able to offer his two children a university education so that they can train professionally and then obtain a well-paid job.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for his store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a determined person who strives hard to move her family out of poverty. She is blessed with two children. Sonia had a difficult childhood and her parents worked very hard for things. Since then, she has followed into her parent's small business selling slippers and bags. 

Sonia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as plastic ware. Her loan will generate a higher income that will be sufficient to meet her family's needs. Sonia will save for her children's future and she hopes they will be spared life's difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase plastic ware to sell

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita is the loving mother of one child who is in school. She is 39 years old and married. Narcita has been engaged in the farming business for almost six years. She is enjoying this type of business, since it is her family's main source of income. Narcita’s husband is her partner in growing their business of planting and harvesting rice on their farm. 

Narcita and her husband are diligently managing their farming business to ensure that they will earn an income from every crop. The couple is doing some field activities to lessen their expenditure in farming and to be able to cover their daily needs. 

With regards to their farming business, Narcita is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, seeds to plant and herbicides for plant care. She hopes to have good crops and to earn an income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds to plant and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is 25 years old and recently married. She supports her husband in his livestock business. Her husband sells milk to community clients. He gets up early in the morning to milk the cows and then sells that milk for a very reasonable price. Lubna's husband offers very good quality milk an that is why he earns good income from his business. Lubna helps take care of the business and she feeds the cattle and keeps the stalls clean.

Lubna is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to assist the family business and purchase a dairy cow. This will increase the quantity of milk her husband can provide and help him to fulfill client needs. Lubna's husband has been operating his business for many years and she is very confident that his business will become more successful as a result of her loan. In this photo, the woman holding the Asasah passbook is Lubna.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nit's Group

texts.en:
Nit, 37, is a mother of three children who depend on her and all of them are still in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, of Battambang province in Cambodia where farming is common for a living. She is a local farmer of 1.5 hectare of farmland and she has been in this business for 10 years to support her family.

Nit received her first loan from Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, one year ago and she completely repaid the loan with VisionFund. Since 2011, the loan has helped her family's conditions improve. Now she is leading a group of four members to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the leader, she will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her dry season rice on her 1.5 hectare of land. She hopes that she will gain more income for her family and that she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor palabra para caracterizar a Alejandro, un joven de 21 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando y laborando para generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir a sus padres con los ingresos de su hogar. Alejandro se dedica desde hace 3 años aproximadamente a la comercialización de vinos y aperitivos de vino. Su negocio lo inició gracias a que una conocida suya es la dueña de una empresa de licores de la ciudad y esta le vende los vinos y Alejandro se encarga, bajo su responsabilidad, de la comercialización de estos. Alejandro es reconocido por ser una persona muy amable y por ofrecer muy buen servicio, además de que se le conoce por su gran carisma y siempre querer ofrecerles un bienestar a todas las personas que lo rodean. Gracias a que Alejandro tiene muy buenos clientes, cuenta con un gran pedido por parte de uno de ellos que no alcanza a satisfacer con el inventario que cuenta actualmente, es por esto que con el fin de responder a su cliente con el pedido, Alejandro busca un préstamo que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de vinos y aperitivos de vino para cumplir con un gran pedido que le ha hecho un cliente suyo.

Alejandro espera poder seguir aumentando sus ventas y poder incrementar más la capacidad de su negocio. Además, ya quiere empezar a comercializar los vinos en otros municipios de modo que pueda generar empleo para personas vulnerables que requieran de unos ingresos y no hayan encontrado oportunidades laborales. Alejandro sueña con tener una muy buena calidad de vida junto a su familia, donde les pueda ofrecer a sus padres una buena estabilidad económica, además, quiere culminar sus estudios y poder continuar con su negocio hasta convertirlo en una gran comercializadora.
texts.en:
"Entrepreneur" is the best word to describe Alejandro, a young man of 21 who is studying and working to generate his own income and contribute to his parents' household income. Alejandro has worked for about three years selling wines and wine-based aperitifs. He began his business through a friend who is the owner of a liquor business in the city. She sells him the wines and Alejandro is in charge of marketing them. Alejandro is known for being a very friendly person who offers very good service, in addition to which he is known for his great charisma, and he always wants to offer a sense of well-being to the all the people who surround him. Thanks to having many good customers, he has a large order from one of them, and he doesn't have enough in his present inventory to satisfy it. This is why, with the aim of responding to the customer with the order, Alejandro is looking for a loan that will offer him the possibility of buying the wines and wine-based aperitifs to fill the large order that his customer has placed.

Alejandro hopes to be able to continue increasing his sales and further expanding the capacity of his business. In addition, he wants to begin selling wine in other towns so that he can generate work for vulnerable people who need income and have not found work opportunities. Alejandro dreams of having a very good quality of life with his family, where he can offer his parents good economic stability. Furthermore, he wants to finish his studies and be able to continue with his business until he converts it into a big commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to buy wines and aperitifs to fill a large order that a customer has placed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a seam sealing machine so that he can make shoes more efficiently

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 55 years old and says that he is still strong and able to do field activities to minimize his farm expenditures. He is the father of five and works hard to provide for his family's needs. Ismael has had his share of problems and different encounters in life, but he has not lost his faith in God and has faith that he will surpass his difficulties. 

Ismael is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm to sustain his large rice crop and provide for all of his farm inputs. He hopes to use his loan and maintain his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer while his wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker in Hong Kong. Joel and his child meet their needs daily through his wife's remittances. Joel teaches himself and his child to be careful with their expenditures because living without the mother on their side is difficult. At present, Joel performs as mother and father of his child.

Joel wants to live happily with his wife. He will work harder to have financial stability so his wife will no longer go back to work abroad.

Due to costly farm inputs at present, Joel is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 for additional working capital for his farm. He will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain the business. Joel wishes to have productive crops, earn a higher income and save some of it. In the future, Joel will be having financial stability while he is operating his farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sreymoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sreymoeun is 35 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She and her husband live in a village in the Thmor Koul district. Her husband is a newspaper agent while she sometimes works for others to better earn a living.  Sreymoeun earns about $4 per day to feed her family and saves $1 a day. 

Sreymoeun’s group has been with VisionFund for six years and this group repaid their prior loan with VisionFund. The loan helped her afford sufficient food and allowed her to send her children to school. 

Her group of two members is requesting another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use this entire loan to buy a bed for her family. This loan will enable her to have a decent bed as a household asset for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a bed for her family

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 30 years old and is married, with three children. To earn a living, Mary Ann engages in buying and selling gasoline in the village of Maligaya. Right now, Mary Ann is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase more gasoline to resell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 53 years old, a very enduring person who works as a manicurist and pedicurist in the village. She offers good service and that’s why she has gained very loyal customers. As part of her service, she walks house to house and offers door to door service. She is very much thankful because with her unending patience she has slowly lifted up her family.


At present, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 pesos to buy new nail polish, a pusher, a nipper and cuticle remover as new supplies to be used in her service. She hopes that this loan will make it possible for her to provide the necessities for her family and improve their living situation.

loans.use: to buy new nail polish, a pusher, a nipper and cuticle remover as new supplies used in her service
